content.description: Top Heavy is a nice line on good orange rock. Steep dynamic movement through positive holds and fun sequences leads to a very committing and high 'Kelly Mantle'. The crux of Top Heavy may be pulling over the top way out from the hands of your spotters.
content.protection: A bunch of pads for the pad perch.
content.location: Top Heavy is the center line on the tilted orange face on the East side of the Blue Marble. Take the micro gully from the wash to a pad stance below the start.

content.description: Pluto is the easiest and shortest problem and hosts the friendliest top out on the wall. Uncharacteristic of the other climbs in the area. Climbs through a series of horizontal mail slots and interesting pockets. A great warm up and good rock!
content.protection: Landing is pretty good for a dirt hill, more pads the better.
content.location: Located on the furthest left side of The Blue Marble Wall.

content.description: Hitchhikin' to Heaven climbs the slightest slab to the right of Earth. Small holds and feet will keep you on toes until standing on top.
content.protection: Pads will protect the ground, falling up high not recommended.
content.location: Starts 20ft to climbers right of Earth

content.description:
Named in a ode to some of the youngsters on my climbing team. You'll have to ask them for a definition... 

  FPPS is a great highball on a secluded wall that climbs through high quality Coconino Sandstone features. Great movement! My vote as the best line on the wall because of the endurance style moves and the less gnarly top out as the others to the right.
content.location: FPPS is on the left side of the Blue Marble Wall. Starts on lower tier before moving left and directly up through the center of the wall. Not to be confused with Top Heavy which goes straight up from start.

content.description: Earth stand-starts on the obvious holds at chest level. Climb through series of good holds and pockets and into the initial crux. At the midway ledge rest it up and prep yourself for the committing, no going back, second half. True crux is above the Midway Ledge.
content.protection: Pads will protect the first half to the midway ledge, a fall from above is not recommended.
content.location: Earth climbs the large and intimidating face downstream of the Trailer Park just before The "Pictograph" Cave

content.description: Tall cirque of rock down from trailer park. Near "Pictograph" Cave.
